tree.original_reasoning:
Okay, I need to complete the Java code provided. Let me look through the code to see what's missing. 

The user has given a class ApacheCommonsDemo with a main method. There are several comments indicating where the code needs to be filled in.

First, checking if "12345" is numeric using StringUtils. They already have that line with StringUtils.isNumeric, so that's done.

Then reversing "Hello World" with StringUtils.reverse, which is also already filled in.

The next part is to read the content of "example.txt" into a String using Apache Commons IO. The current line has a comment saying "TODO: Your code here". The variable fileContent is supposed to get the content. 

I remember that Apache Commons IO's FileUtils has a method to read a file into a string. The method is probably readFileToString or something similar. Let me think: FileUtils.readFileToString(File file, String encoding) would do that. So the code should be FileUtils.readFileToString(new File("example.txt"), "UTF-8"), maybe? Or maybe the default encoding is okay, but the parameters here need to match. Since the next line when writing uses "UTF-8", perhaps they expect specifying the encoding here as well. 

Wait, the line to write uses FileUtils.writeStringToFile with "UTF-8", so maybe the reading should also specify the encoding. So the missing line would be:

FileUtils.readFileToString(new File("example.txt"), "UTF-8");

So that's the value for fileContent.

The other parts after that are already filled except the MD5 part, but that's also done with DigestUtils.md5Hex.

So the only missing part is the fileContent assignment. Let me check again. The instruction says to output only the missing code. The user wants the code that replaces the TODO comment. So the answer should be the expression for fileContent, which is the FileUtils call. 

I think that's it. Let me make sure there's no other missing parts. The rest of the code looks complete. So the missing line is indeed the FileUtils.readFileToString with the filename and encoding.
